body:
Currently that setting isn't exposed at the C# level. 

Is that required for your use case or just nice to have?

There are some open PRs that have attempted this:

https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/6291
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/7315

If you want to contribute, please see the PR for exposing C# configuration knobs for the TRT EP: https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/7808. Using this PR as a template, some small changes to #6291 should enable the same for the CUDA EP as well.

@skottmckay Thank you for the quick reply.
"Applying "gpu_mem_limit" to CUDA Execution Provider in C#" is required for the system we are building.

We want to run 3 C# applications, and each of them uses an AI model for inference.
We only have one Nvidia GPU, so we attempted to make them share one Nvidia GPU ,but the GPU memory 
was not enough to go around. 
As a result, we need this feature badly to limit the GPU memory usage of each application to make them be 
able to share one GPU.

@skottmckay 
I would be grateful if you could tell me whether the following workaround is possible.

Step1 Build a DLL that uses onnxruntime in C++ to run an AI model for inference ,and  apply "gpu_mem_limit" to CUDA Execution Provider 
Step2 Call the DLL build in Step1 in our C# application to run the AI inference and get the  result from it.

Thank you in advance.

@hariharans29 Thank you for your response.
I want to give it a try to see whether I can help. 
I'm still a student and new to github. 
If possible, could you please tell me how to start?

I was wondering whether the following steps are correct.
Step1 Fork microsoft/onnxruntime
Step2 Clone it and make a new branch in my local PC.
Step3 Refer to [#7808](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/7808) and use it as a template
Step4 Refer to [#6291](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/6291) to add "gpu_mem_limit" option to CUDA Execution Provider in C#
Step5 Push it to my github repo
Step6 Open a new pull request 

Thank you in advance.

issue.title: C# adding option for cudnn_conv_algo_search : DEFAULT

labels.name: feature request
labels.description: request for unsupported feature or enhancement

labels.name: ep:CUDA
labels.description: issues related to the CUDA execution provider

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
Platform : Windows, C#
Version : Onnxruntime 1.9.0 Nuget package

Hellow, I am testing the speed of yolov5 model, and it is twice as slow as pytorch version.

after taking a look at issues, I have found Issue [#7212](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/7212) is related to mine.

Nsight System shows the use of **volta_scudnn kernels,** while running tensorRt shows me **turing kernels.** 

So I believe onnxruntime is not choosing best op.

I am trying to add cuda provider option :  {cudnn_conv_algo_search : DEFAULT}


However, in c#, AppendExecutionProvider_CUDA(int deviceId) does not have parameter to pass cudaprovider options. 

Is this feature availabe in c# version?

I am also referring to these, for they are directly related to my issue.
[#6291](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/6291)
[#7315](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/7315)

**What happened to OrtCudaProviderOptions?
Because I don't see this struct in the nuget package.**

Thank you

issue.title: Enable CUDA provider option configuration for C#

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
**Description**: 

This is the CUDA EP equivalent of the PR https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/7808 (All the design choices have already been discussed there). 

This change makes the `OrtCUDAProviderOptions` struct opaque and supports setting options that can be converted to a string. Just like the TensorRT PR, an API to set options that can't be strings (`user_compute_stream` and `default_memory_arena_cfg`) is not yet supported and will be added incrementally. Since these are not very commonly used, it is okay to leave them unsupported for now. For users who still need them, they can still use the legacy struct and its corresponding ORT APIs.  

**Motivation and Context**
1) Enables basic configuration of the CUDA EP via C# (Resolves https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/9730 and https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/8995)

2) Introduces a new C API CUDA EP configuration - `cudnn_conv_use_max_workspace`. This was already available via Python but not available for C API users. This configuration is particularly important for fp16 Conv heavy models. See https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/9162 and https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/9916 for details as to why. By this reasoning, this PR should resolve this perf complaint - https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/9420. 

3) Addresses a backlog item to make the `OrtCUDAProviderOptions` opaque
